data.title: Great Thai Food!
data.text: Stopped here for a quick lunch before going to a meeting. Excellent yellow curry and soups! Great service and very clean restaurant. A very pleasant surprise!

data.title: Great Thai place with wonderful hospitality
data.text: Went here to celebrate my father's birthday, there were 7 of us plus a toddler. The owners and servers made us feel like family and the food was excellent. We were all very satisfied. Also the restaurant is VERY clean!

data.title: Delicious food and super clean
data.text: My wife and I live in the Scranton area and visit this restaurant often. All dishes we've had here (love the Pad Thai, Lad Nar, Papaya Salad) are delicious and you can tell that the owners pride themselves on not only the consistency, but also the visual presentation of each dish.  I'm most impressed by the cleanliness of the restaurant - glasses, dishes, utensils are spotless.  My wife tells me the restrooms are just as clean!

data.title: great for bubble tea
data.text: this place has some really great bubble tea. i always order the honey dew flavor. but i've had the vanilla, strawberry, lechi, and banana. all are great but honey dew if my favorite. i've only eaten dinner here once, but it was really tasty. i ordered regular old pad thai and its really good. i like mine on the mild side but they have 5 different heat level for u to pick from. i will be going back:)

data.title: Thai a Ribbon Round Your Finger for This One!
data.text: Just finished a scrumptious Pad Thai dish from the lunch menu at Thai Thai Scranton.  With lunch prices starting at $7.99, you can't go wrong here.  Being located just one block off the historic city courthouse square with its many memorials is an added plus.

data.title: Good Thai Food
data.text:
A welcome surprise...we had several great Thai restaurants in Brooklyn, but none when we moved to Rzesów. Didn't expect to find one in our new locale. 

The food was really good- flavorful and crispy.

I would have given 5 bullets except:1. BYOB (I will bring my own wine next time.)
2. Dishes were a bit too sweet for my taste. (My wife thought hers was fine.)
3. Not quite spicy enough-(probably the locals can't handle it.)

We will definitely return.

data.title: Sooooooo Delicious
data.text: This was our first time having Thai food. We brought a bottle of wine (byob) & they brought a bucket of ice and opened it and poured it for us. We ordered the crab Ragoon which were pretty good. Fiancée had a large duck entree level 3 hot. I had the drunken noodles with chicken level 2 hot. We enjoyed our dinners so much. They gave us extra sauces for heat and checked on us often. Great first experience!! Will be back.

data.title: Delicious Thai in Scranton
data.text: We went in for lunch, the restaurant was very clean and comfortable.  The hostess and server were very pleasant.  The food was at the table very quickly, hot and delicious! The prices were reasonable. We have been there several times before, always a great experience!  Parking can be difficult but worth the effort.

data.title: Always Delicious, Always Consistent
data.text: Thai Thai is one of my favorite local Thai restaurants! The food is always fresh, the meals are delicious and the service is always friendly and accommodating!

data.title: Great food and atmosphere
data.text: We went with a party of 6 to celebrate a birthday. All of the food was excellent. Service was super, they really cared about our opinions. Our server knew the menu inside and out. She answered all of our questions and made great suggestions based on each of our likes and dislikes. Oh and it's a BYOB. Great time. Will go again.

data.title: Great for birthdays!
data.text: The food and service is always great but especially if you're celebrating a birthday, they really know how to make you feel special

data.title: Friendly, great food, very reasonable
data.text: This is a very cute restaurant in the heart of Scranton. Very authentic cuisine (I know. I have traveled to Thailand many times.) Their Pad Thai is absolutely excellent... as good as any fine restaurant in Bangkok. My wife says that the Pad Cashew is wonderful. Terrific service and excellent lunch menu. If you like Thai food, you cannot go wrong with this restaurant.

data.title: New Years Eve dinner
data.text: Thai Thai graciously hosted me and my partner for NYE. I have eaten Thai before, however, it was his first time.  Great service, delicious cusine, and most of all we brought our own wine.  A great evening meal we had to bring in the New Year of 2016. I recommend the drunken noodles and papaya salad. Happy new year!!! We will be back in the near future.

data.title: Great Thai
data.text: I have eaten here many times and never been disappointed.  The Red Curry dishes are just great, and it is a BYOB establishment.

data.title: Good food and good service
data.text:
Though we live close to Scranton, this was our first opportunity to try Thai Thai.  It turned out to be a great choice.  Service was great, food was piping hot and freshly prepared, and it was just a good experience.  We had Thai Spring Rolls, Tom Kha Gai soup, Drunken Noodles, and Pad Cashew Nut.  One portion of each plus beverages came to under $50, which I think is reasonable.  Everything was delicious, but the Tom Kha Gai was a real standout. 

When you order a spicy dish, they ask how hot you want it on a scale of 1-5.  We took 5, and it was just hot enough without being overpowering.  If you REALLY like your food spicy, you might ask them to kick it up to 6.

Be aware, this restaurant, while it has a wide selection of bubble teas, is BYOB.

data.title: Authentic Thai Food
data.text: The restaurant has delicious thai food. The staff is very accommodating and it  is a fun place to eat at!!!

data.title: Good Food and Service
data.text: Very good location, service, and variety of food. The waiter was so friendly and very attentive. In my opinion, I think this restaurant is the best Thai restaurant in Scranton.

data.title: Always excellent!
data.text: I went to graduate school in Scranton and this was one of my favorites. Now that I'm back for a weekend I had to go stop by. They have improved their menus, not the selections but they printed nicer, classier menus; the soups are awesome;  and there is something for everyone. I will miss Thai Thai when I head back down South.

data.title: Bye bye Thai Thai
data.text: Lovely establishment with no beer or wine. Service is unbelievably pleasant, friendly and attentive. Time from ordering to tabling is blindingly quick. Everything fresh and tasty. Entree portions are small and appetizer portions are on the larger side. However, the bubble tea is more of a smoothie and the "5-star" spicy equates to a "mild" at more culturally-authentic restaurants. You won't need to say Hi Hi to Thai Thai if you are looking for a more satisfy experience.

data.title: Great Thai Food
data.text: We went to Thai Thai as a group at lunch.  The food was very good. We had a larger group, so the service was a little slow, but the food was made the way we asked and was very good.  I would highly recommend.
